# PR Summary

`ProcessStartInfo.ArgumentList` can't be used as the current cmdlet supports: `start-process ping -argumentlist "-n 2 localhost"` which would then treat those 3 arguments as 1 and fail.  

## PR Context

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5576

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Unfortunately, upon closer inspection, I don't see a way to solve the problem without introducing a big breaking change.  Current behavior allows:

```powershell
start-process ping -wait -nonewwindow -argumentlist "-n 2", "localhost"
```

Where all elements of `-ArgumentList` is simply joined into a single string forming: `ping -n 2 localhost`.

We can't start treating them as individual arguments since there is no way to determine what the user intended and arbitrarily add quotes or separating them into individual args.

comments.author: felixfbecker
comments.body: Maybe we could get a new parameter `-RawArgumentList` that is _always_ passed as-is to dotnet `ArgumentList`?
